description: The `synthetic.project_costs` table represents a record of financial expenditures associated with various projects, identified by the unique `cost_id`. Each entry logs details such as the project identifier (`project_id`), date of cost incurred, category, description of the costs, and whether the cost is billable, supported by additional columns like `amount`, and invoice identification (`invoice_id`). This table likely plays a crucial role in tracking and managing the financial aspects of projects within the database, though it does not explicitly relate to other tables based on the provided information.

columns.name: cost_id
columns.description: This column represents a unique identifier for each record in the project costs table, ensuring each project cost entry has a distinct and sequentially assigned number. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: project_id
columns.description: This column represents unique identifiers for various projects within the dataset. These identifiers enable linking project-related costs to their respective projects.

columns.name: cost_date
columns.description: This column represents the specific date on which the project costs were incurred or recorded. It ensures that each expense entry in the project costs table is associated with its corresponding calendar date.

columns.name: cost_category
columns.description: The column represents descriptions or narratives related to various aspects or activities within a project, which could include tasks, strategies, or discussions. Purpose unclear from available data as the sample values do not specify distinct categories or labels.

columns.name: description
columns.description: This column likely contains textual descriptions or summaries related to various aspects of projects, such as project goals, operations, or other associated activities. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: This column represents the monetary values associated with the costs of various projects. Each entry reflects the financial expenditure for a specific project within the dataset.

columns.name: is_billable
columns.description: This field indicates whether the costs associated with a project can be billed to the client. If the value is true, the costs are chargeable; if false, they are not.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.description: Represents unique identifiers for invoices related to project expenses. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a project cost entry was initially recorded in the system. The purpose of capturing this information is to track when financial entries related to projects are created, helping in auditing and timeline analysis.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when the project cost data was last updated. Values default to the current timestamp when no other value is provided.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX project_costs_pkey ON synthetic.project_costs USING btree (cost_id)
